comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 5.01; Windows 98)
Build Identifier: 

In the at page 
http://edit.yahoo.com/config/eval_register?.intl=us&new=1&.done=http%
3A//mail.yahoo.com&.src=ym&.testid=lisu_ym2&.v=0&.u=3rjmrqh1h5em4&partner=&.p=&p
romo=&.last=  , enter the details in all fields and clicked on i agree button , 
the second page registration will not be displayed. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.enter www.yahoomail.com
2. click on new user sign up
3. enter all fields , and then click I Agree button

Actual Results:  
Can't Find server page, page the was not connectd properly

Expected Results:  
registration of 2nd page

joshbirnbaum-mozil@yahoo.com
comments.text:
What server was it trying to connect to?  Are you sure it wasn't a temporary
failure on Yahoo's end?
comments.creator: joshbirnbaum-mozil@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
What server was it trying to connect to?  Are you sure it wasn't a temporary
failure on Yahoo's end?

comments.author: ZookQValem@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
From the source code, it showed the next page the browser go to after submission
is "https://edit.yahoo.com/config/register" plus variety of post strings.  It
seem to work okay but I did not try to register for an account.

comments.raw_text: Reporter, do you still see this with Firefox 3.6.3 or later in safe mode?
comments.text: Reporter, do you still see this with Firefox 3.6.3 or later in safe mode?
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com

comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
